info.author: Andrey Vlasovskikh
info.description:
README
======

*This is a beta release. The library may be changed significantly.*

Release Date:
    2010-03-11

.. image:: http://iterpipes.pirx.ru/_static/logo.png


Rationale
---------

Python is a good choice for many software tools, but it lacks clarity and
simplicity of command shells when it comes to running command pipelines from
scripts. The standard ``subprocess`` module provides basic inter-processing
tools, but it requires lots of lines to express a single shell line.

``iterpipes`` is trying to overcome this limitation by representing a shell
command pipeline as *a function over iterables*, similar to functions from the
standard ``itertools`` module.


Getting Started
---------------

1. Download and install iterpipes
2. Read the `introduction`__
3. Get familiar with the `iterpipes API`__

__ http://iterpipes.pirx.ru/basics.html
__ http://iterpipes.pirx.ru/iterpipes.html

The simplest way to install ``iterpipes`` is via ``pip`` or
``easy_install``::

    $ pip install iterpipes

Packages for `Arch Linux`__ and `FreeBSD`__ are also available.

__ http://aur.archlinux.org/packages.php?ID=33107
__ http://www.freebsd.org/cgi/cvsweb.cgi/ports/devel/py-iterpipes/
info.keywords: shell pipe pipeline subprocess infinite iterable iterator iter dataflow
info.name: iterpipes
info.summary: Shell pipelines in Python using shell-like syntax
